Member Function Documentation

virtual gaia::webkit::WebView* gaia::webkit::WebViewFragment::getWebView ( ) [virtual]
gaia::core::Widget* gaia::webkit::WebViewFragment::onCreateWidget ( gaia::core::LayoutInflater *  inflater,
gaia::core::WidgetController *  container,
gaia::core::Persistence *  savedInstanceState 
) [virtual]

Called to have the fragment instantiate its user interface widget.

This is optional, and non-graphical fragments can return null (which is the default implementation). This will be called between #onCreate(Persistence*) and #onPageCreated(Persistence*).

If you return a View from here, you will later be called in onDestroyWidget when the widget is being released.

Parameters:
inflaterThe LayoutInflater Object that can be used to inflate any widgets in the fragment,
containerIf non-null, this is the parent widget that the fragment's UI should be attached to. The fragment should not add the widget itself, but this can be used to generate the LayoutParams of the widget.
savedInstanceStateIf non-null, this fragment is being re-constructed from a previous saved state as given here.
Returns:
Return the Widget for the fragment's UI, or NULL.

Reimplemented from gaia::core::Fragment.

void gaia::webkit::WebViewFragment::onDestroy ( ) [virtual]

Called when the fragment is no longer in use.

This is called after onStop() and before onDetach().

Reimplemented from gaia::core::Fragment.

void gaia::webkit::WebViewFragment::onDestroyWidget ( ) [virtual]

Called when the widget previously created by onCreateWidget has been detached from the fragment.

The next time the fragment needs to be displayed, a new widget will be created. This is called after onStop() and before onDestroy(). It is called regardless of whether onCreateWidget returned a non-null widget. Internally it is called after the widget's state has been saved but before it has been removed from its parent.

Reimplemented from gaia::core::Fragment.

void gaia::webkit::WebViewFragment::onPause ( ) [virtual]

Called when the Fragment is no longer resumed.

This is generally tied to Page::onPause of the containing Page's lifecycle.

Reimplemented from gaia::core::Fragment.

void gaia::webkit::WebViewFragment::onResume ( ) [virtual]

Called when the fragment is visible to the user and page running.

This is generally tied to Page::onResume() of the containing Page's lifecycle.

Reimplemented from gaia::core::Fragment.
